definitions.definition: after a long time, especially when there has been some difficulty or delay

examples.text: The performance finally started half an hour late.
The law was finally passed in May 2019.
I finally managed to get her attention.
Are you finally going to tell me why I’m here?
When they finally arrived it was well past midnight.
Two years of hard work and waiting were finally over.
Here, finally, we come to the heart of the problem.
Finally ready, they all set off.

definitions.definition: used to introduce the last in a list of things

examples.text: And finally, I would like to thank you all for coming here today.
Finally, stir in the fruit and walnuts.

definitions.definition: in a way that ends all discussion about something

examples.text: The matter was not finally settled until later.
A Home Office spokesman said nothing had been finally decided upon.
